articles.title: How serious is the Russian spy ship move?
articles.summary: Russia's Yantar, officially an oceanic research vessel, is regarded by the UK and allies as a spy ship, raising significant concerns for Britain's defence chiefs. It is suspected of secretly mapping critical undersea infrastructure, posing a potential threat to maritime security and communication networks. This highlights ongoing geopolitical intelligence gathering and strategic competition in international waters.

articles.title: Anchorage–Mezo partnership opens institutional access to BTC-backed loans
articles.summary: Mezo, a Bitcoin-native DeFi platform, has partnered with Anchorage Digital to provide institutional clients with low-cost stablecoin loans and short-term veBTC rewards. This collaboration leverages BTC-backed borrowing and yield mechanisms within the decentralized finance space, expanding financial product offerings for institutions interested in the cryptocurrency ecosystem. The initiative aims to enhance liquidity and access to crypto-backed lending.

articles.title: Michigan iGaming, Sports Betting Soar During Record-Setting October
articles.summary: Michigan's sports betting sector achieved $73.8 million in gross receipts in October, marking a substantial 123.6% year-over-year increase. This growth in a US state highlights the rapid expansion of the digital gambling and entertainment industry. It reflects evolving consumer trends and the significant economic impact of regulated online betting platforms in advanced economies.

articles.title: Randy Jones, Padres Pitcher and Cy Young Winner Who Became the Heart of San Diego Baseball, Dies at 75
articles.summary: Randy Jones, the legendary San Diego Padres pitcher, has died at 75. Known for his crafty left arm and everyman charm, he was one of the franchise's earliest and most beloved stars. His passing marks the end of an era for Padres fans and the wider baseball community, remembering a true icon of the sport who left an indelible mark on baseball history.

articles.title: China masterminded Rafale disinfo campaign: US report
articles.summary: China launched an extensive disinformation campaign against India's Rafale fighter jets. This elaborate operation employed fake news, dubious social media accounts, and AI-generated images to discredit the advanced aircraft, specifically after India's deployment. The campaign underscores China's persistent information warfare tactics aimed at undermining India's defence capabilities and creates a need for vigilance against foreign influence operations targeting critical military assets.

articles.title: Delhi blast case: Trouble mounts for Al Falah University Chairman Siddiqui as ED steps in
articles.summary: The Enforcement Directorate (ED) is reportedly preparing to share its investigation findings regarding Al Falah group chairman Jawad Siddiqui with Delhi Police. This move is expected to prompt the police to register a fresh First Information Report (FIR) against Siddiqui, indicating escalating legal troubles. The ED's action suggests significant evidence has been uncovered, potentially leading to new charges in a case originating from New Delhi.

articles.title: Noise-Induced Hearing Loss Enhances Ca2+-Dependent Electrical Activity in Lateral Cochlear Efferents
articles.summary: Exposure to loud or prolonged noise critically damages the cochlea and triggers subsequent brain changes, leading to hearing loss and altered speech comprehension. This scientific understanding highlights the significant impact of noise on auditory health and cognitive functions. For SSB aspirants, this underscores the importance of ear protection and awareness in potentially noisy operational environments, even as further research clarifies specific long-term neurological effects.

articles.title: For conservative media, New York City Mayor-elect Zohran Mamdani quickly becomes attack target
articles.summary: New York City Mayor-elect Zohran Mamdani swiftly became an attack target for conservative media following his election, as reported by The Associated Press on November 18, 2025. This immediate scrutiny highlights the politically charged environment and intense media attention new public figures face, signaling potential challenges for the incoming mayor-elect even before assuming office.
